Article Title: Bihar election results: Where is Jan Suraaj? Prashant Kishor‚Äôs party‚Äôs ambitious debut fails to show up in trends
Article Text:
File photo

What Times Of India Reporters Saw In Bihar | I Witness #biharelection2025

What trends in Bihar show

What did the exit polls say?

As trends in the Bihar assembly election results emerge, NDA alliance has taken decisive leads across the state with Mahagathbandhan trailing. However, one name that is notably absent from the numbers is Prashant Kishor ‚Äôs Jan Suraaj. Despite promises to reshape Bihar‚Äôs political landscape, the results so far show no significant traction for the party.According to latest trends, the ruling National Democratic Alliance (NDA) sweeping elections with Mahagathbandhan lagging behind.The early picture is dominated by the two major blocs:NDA has surged past the majority mark early in the day, with both the BJP and JD(U) registering strong performances.Mahagathbandhan (MGB) trails behind, with RJD performing significantly better than alliance partner Congress ‚Äî but still not matching the NDA‚Äôs spread.RJD, despite MGB trailing overall, is showing up as one of the top individual parties in several seats.Jan Suraaj, however, does not appear in the early seat charts, and its vote share ‚Äî where visible ‚Äî is marginal, rarely impacting the margins in competitive constituencies.The Jan Suraaj Party contested its maiden elections this month with more than 200 candidates in the fray. The party, formed by poll strategist Prashant Kishore, initially announced plans to contest all 243 seats in the Bihar Assembly.The number dipped slightly after Jan Suraaj faced defections, ‚Äòforced‚Äô withdrawals, and other setbacks during the nomination process.Prashant Kishor, the election strategist turned politician, set an ambitious victory target for his party in the state assembly elections. He had also stated that if his party fails to achieve this, he will consider it a personal defeat.However, all exit polls predicted a dismal performance for Prashant Kishore‚Äôs Jan Suraaj Party in the Bihar assembly elections . The maximum number of seats any pollster is willing to give to the party is five. While Kishore himself did not contest the polls, his party‚Äôs vote share numbers will determine whether they have been able to make any significant dent in the votes of either the NDA or the Mahagathbandhan.
Article Summary: Nda has surged past the majority mark early in the day, with both the bjp and jd(u) registering strong performances. Mahagathbandhan (mgb) trails behind, with rjd performing significantly better than alliance partner congress ‚Äî but still not matching nda‚Äôs spread.

Article Title: Bihar Election Results 2025: Top 10 winners and losers
Article Text: Bihar's 2025 election sees the NDA secure a decisive victory, with Nitish Kumar and PM Modi emerging as key winners. Women voters played a pivotal role, driving turnout and influencing the mandate. Conversely, Tejashwi Yadav faced a significant setback, failing to convert momentum into votes, while Rahul Gandhi and Prashant Kishor also experienced disappointing results.
Article Summary: Bihar's 2025 election sees the nda secure a decisive victory, with nitish kumar and pm modi emerging as key winners. Women voters played a pivotal role, driving turnout and influencing the mandate. Tejashwi yadav faced a significant setback, failing to convert momentum into votes, while rahul gandhi and prashant kishor also experienced disappointing results.

Article Title: 'Election not fair from beginning': Rahul Gandhi's first reaction to Cong's dismal show in Bihar polls
Article Text:
‚ÄòBihar‚Äôs New MY Formula Is Mahila & Youth‚Äô: PM Modi Targets RJD-Congress After NDA‚Äôs Landslide Win

NEW DELHI: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi delivered his first response to the Congress Party‚Äôs poor performance in the Bihar assembly election, describing the contest as ‚Äúunfair from the very outset‚Äù and insisting that the party, along with the wider INDIA alliance, will undertake a detailed review of what went wrong.In a post on X, he wrote: ‚ÄúI express my heartfelt gratitude to those millions of voters in Bihar who placed their trust in the Mahagathbandhan. This result in Bihar is truly astonishing. We could not secure victory in an election that was unfair from the very outset. This battle is for the protection of the Constitution and democracy. The Congress Party and the INDIA alliance will thoroughly review this outcome and make their efforts to save democracy even more effective. ‚ÄùHis remarks came as the NDA surged to a historic victory, securing over 200 seats, while the Mahagathbandhan registered just 33. The Congress won only six of the 61 seats it contested, prompting sharp internal and public reactions from party leaders. Rahul Gandhi repeated his accusation that the electoral process was compromised, saying the party ‚Äúcould not achieve victory in an election that was not fair from the very beginning.Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge also expressed deep disappointment but urged party workers not to lose heart. In his post on X, he wrote: ‚ÄúWe respect the decision of the people of Bihar and shall continue our fight against those forces that are engaged in weakening democracy by misusing constitutional institutions. We shall study the election results in depth and shall present a detailed account after understanding the reasons for the outcomes. To those voters in Bihar who have supported the Mahagathbandhan, we are deeply grateful from the bottom of our hearts. I wish to tell every Congress worker that there is no need for you to feel disheartened. You are our pride, honour, and glory. Your hard work is our strength.‚ÄùHe added that the party would ‚Äúcontinue the struggle to protect the Constitution and democracy by staying among the people,‚Äù describing it as a long fight to be waged with ‚Äúcomplete dedication, courage, and truth.‚ÄùThe NDA‚Äôs emphatic win has strengthened Prime Minister Narendra Modi and chief minister Nitish Kumar, with the BJP emerging as the single largest party, followed closely by JD(U). For the Mahagathbandhan, the result marks a significant setback, particularly for the RJD, which won just 24 seats.As the political dust settles, the Congress leadership appears unified on one point: the Bihar result will be contested politically and organisationally, and the party intends to return to the electorate with renewed resolve.
Article Summary: Congress leader rahul gandhi delivered his first response to the congress party‚Äôs poor performance in the bihar assembly election. He described the contest as ‚Äúunfair from the very outset‚Äù and insisted that the party, along with the wider india alliance, will undertake a detailed review of what went wrong.

Article Title: CJI Gavai on 1979 rape ruling: 'Moment of institutional embarrassment'
Article Text:
CJI BR Gavai (File photo)

CJI on '79 rape ruling: 'Moment of institutional embarrassment'

'No Remorse, God Provoked Me': Lawyer Rakesh Kishore Defends His Shoe Attack On CJI BR Gavai

NEW DELHI: Admitting that Supreme Court failed its citizens, and it is the vigilance of civil society and courage of ordinary people which have kept the judiciary accountable over the years, the CJI termed SC's 1979 verdict as a "moment of institutional embarrassment" which acquitted two policemen accused of raping a young tribal girl inside a police station by taking her "consent" as voluntary because there were no visible marks of physical resistance.Delivering the 30th Justice Sunanda Bhandare Memorial Lecture, CJI B R Gavai said the apex court's verdict in Tukaram v. State of Maharashtra, also known as the Mathura case, was an institutional failure, and court's verdict reflected a deeply regressive and patriarchal understanding of consent, effectively denying the social context of power, coercion, and vulnerability in which sexual violence often occurs."In my view, this decision remains one of the most troubling moments in India's constitutional and judicial history, and I call it a 'moment of institutional embarrassment', where the legal system failed to protect the dignity of the very person it was meant to safeguard. Yet, this judgment also became a turning point. The public outrage and the nationwide protests that followed, led by women's groups, students, and legal activists, ignited the modern Indian women's rights movement.It compelled the nation to confront the inadequacies of its criminal law and catalysed the amendments in criminal law, which redefined the concept of consent and strengthened legal protections against custodial rape," CJI Gavai said.The CJI was speaking on the evolution of law in building a gender equal and inclusive India. He said many pathbreaking laws were passed to bring gender justice, and courts also pitched in to ensure equality through judicial pronouncements, barring few exceptions like the 1979 verdict. He said it resulted in dismantling of the structural inequalities embedded in family and custom, bringing women from the margins of dependency to the centre of constitutional citizenship."Over the past 75 years, India has charted an extraordinary journey in advancing the rights of women and shaping the vision of an inclusive society. From the early struggles for recognition and equality, to the present era of intersectional and participatory justice, the courts have often stood as guardians of equality and human dignity. This evolution has not been without its challenges. There have been moments when judicial interpretations failed to capture the lived realities of women or fell short of the transformative spirit of the Constitution. .. However, the vigilance of civil society, the persistence of women's movements, and the courage of ordinary citizens have together kept the judiciary accountable to the constitutional promise of equality," he said."Therefore, it is important to acknowledge that progress in gender justice has never been the achievement of courts alone. The collective voice of citizens has ensured that regressive precedents were questioned, debated, and ultimately corrected through reform, reinterpretation, or legislative intervention. The dialogue between the courts and the people thus remains one of the most vital sources of India's democratic strength, reminding us that the march toward gender equality is not a destination reached, but a commitment constantly renewed," CJI Gavai said.
Article Summary: Cji b r gavai calls 1979 rape verdict a'moment of institutional embarrassment' he says it is the vigilance of civil society and courage of ordinary people which have kept the judiciary accountable. The cji was speaking on the evolution of law in building a gender equal and inclusive india.

Article Title: Ladakh airbase close to China border activated
Article Text:
Indian Air Force Opens Nyoma Airbase In Ladakh, A Strategic Game-Changer Along The China Frontier

Nyoma airbase underwent Rs 230cr upgrade

Also read:

Also read:

NEW DELHI: In a major booster shot for military capabilities in eastern Ladakh, India on Wednesday operationalised its new Nyoma airbase close to the frontier with China, even as a large Army exercise called 'Poorvi Prachand Prahar' is now under way in Arunachal Pradesh on the eastern front.The developments at the opposite ends of the 3,488-km LAC underscore the high military readiness being maintained along the China frontier. "There is ongoing reset in bilateral diplomatic ties. Military CBMs are also being progressively strengthened but the trust deficit on the ground remains high," a senior officer told TOI. "With no de-escalation along LAC, troops will continue to be forward deployed for 6th successive winter since multiple Chinese incursions into eastern Ladakh in April-May 2020," he said.IAF chief Air Chief Marshal A P Singh himself flew a C-130J 'Super Hercules' aircraft from Hindon on the outskirts of Delhi to the Mudh airfield at Nyoma, among the world's highest at an altitude of 13,710 feet, to formally inaugurate the strategically located airbase. He was accompanied by Western Air Command chief Air Marshal Jeetendra Mishra.Located just about 35 km from the LAC, Nyoma has undergone an upgrade worth Rs 230 crore, which included extending the original airstrip into a 2.7-km 'rigid pavement' runway, a new ATC complex, hangars, crash bay and accommodation, as was earlier reported by TOI.The Mudh airfield is now fully capable of handling and sustaining operations by heavy-lift transport planes and fighter jets from both directions. Primarily, it will help quickly rush troops, weapons and supplies to areas such as Pangong Tso, Demchok and Depsang in eastern Ladakh.The airfield will also be available for fighter operations by early 2026 though high altitude will be a limiting factor. China has assiduously upgraded all its airbases facing India over the last five years to offset the terrain constraints due to high-altitude and rarefied air, which limits the weapon and fuel-carrying capacity of aircraft.China now has additional fighters, including advanced J-20 stealth fighters, as well as bombers, reconnaissance aircraft and drones deployed at its airfields like Hotan, Kashgar, Gargunsa, Shigatse, Bangda, Nyingchi and Hoping. It has also built many new heliports all along the LAC.In the far reaches of the Eastern Himalayas, thousands of soldiers from the 3 Spear Corps of the Indian Army, along with elements of IAF, ITBP and others, are now also engaged in the 'Poorvi Prachand Prahar' exercise in the high-altitude terrain of Mechuka and other areas of Arunachal Pradesh.From airlift and force projection to mountain warfare manoeuvres and multi-domain integrated operations, the exercise aims at validating rapid mobilisation, operational logistics and precision-strike capabilities. "The right force must reach the right place at the right time during conflicts," an officer said.While Nyoma will be another operational base for the IAF in Ladakh after Leh, Kargil and Thoise airfields and the Daulat Beg Oldie ALG (advanced landing ground), India has also progressively upgraded the infrastructure at ALGs like Pasighat, Mechuka, Walong, Tuting, Along and Ziro in Arunachal Pradesh. Similarly, civil ALGs in the middle sector (Uttarakhand, Himachal) of the LAC are also now being increasingly used for military purposes.
Article Summary: Indian air force opens nyoma airbase in ladakh, a strategic game-changer along the china frontier.located just about 35 km from the lac, nyoma has undergone an upgrade worth rs 230 crore, which included extending the original airstrip into a 2.7-km 'rigid pavement' runway.

Article Title: Was WhistlinDiesel arrested? YouTuber‚Äôs reported arrest sparks big buzz after tax details leak online
Article Text:
Was WhistlinDiesel arrested? YouTuber‚Äôs reported arrest sparks big buzz after tax details leak online (Image Via Getty)

WhistlinDiesel opens up about arrest as online reactions explode

‚Äú100% real‚Äù

‚ÄúWon so big they thought I was cheating. (100% real not AI).‚Äù

‚ÄúI am not surprised. I wonder if this was a small mistake or something bigger.‚Äù

‚ÄúA 2mil bond is super high isn‚Äôt it?‚Äù





Cody Shane Detwiler, known everywhere as Cody ‚ÄúWhistlinDiesel,‚Äù became the focus of a huge online buzz on November 13, 2025. The automotive YouTuber was reportedly arrested for tax evasion in Williamson County, Tennessee. This news first came from Reddit user 1Rab, who shared screenshots that looked like custody records. These screenshots showed that Cody Shane Detwiler was arrested on November 12, 2025, at 12:30 PM CST, with a very high bond set at $2,000,000.The screenshots also listed his age as 27, his height as 6 feet, and his eye color as green. They said he was booked and released on the same day, with a release time of 3:06 PM CST. His custody status was marked ‚Äúout of custody,‚Äù and the Williamson County Sheriff‚Äôs Department was listed as the reporting agency. As soon as this information reached Reddit, users reacted fast, asking what led to the arrest and why the bond was so high.A few hours after the screenshots began spreading, Cody ‚ÄúWhistlinDiesel‚Äù Detwiler confirmed the reports through an Instagram post on November 13, 2025.He wrote that the situation wasand added,He did not share more details about the tax charges but made it clear that the arrest did happen.His followers and Reddit users continued reacting. User Sauwercraud said, ‚ÄúCoffeezilla is gonna have a good day.‚ÄùAnother user named TringleBus wrote,User MidBoss11 commented,These reactions showed shock, confusion, and curiosity across the community.Also Read: Emiru Sparks Confusion By Revealing An Unexpected Warning To Stop Flying Alone After Her TwitchCon Assault The news also reminded people of a past case involving his cameraman, Keller Moore.In April 2024, Keller Moore told the VINwiki Car Stories YouTube channel that he had been arrested in 2023 after hosting a family-friendly exotic car show.He said, ‚ÄúI got charged with five counts of inciting a riot‚Ä¶ it was the craziest thing.‚Äù Cody ‚ÄúWhistlinDiesel‚Äù Detwiler also made headlines in June 2025 after an accident during a video shoot with Kick streamer Adin Ross. With all this history, many fans are now waiting for official updates on the reported arrest.
Article Summary: Cody shane detwiler, known everywhere as cody ‚Äúwhistlindiesel,‚Äù became the focus of a huge online buzz on november 13, 2025. The automotive youtuber was reportedly arrested for tax evasion in williamson county, tennessee. This news first came from reddit user 1rab, who shared screenshots that looked like custody records.

Article Title: Aidan Hutchinson injury update: Detroit gains key edge rusher back while secondary concerns surge ahead of Week 11
Article Text:
Lions get Aidan Hutchinson yet secondary concerns loom (Image via: Getty Images)

Lions Get Aidan Hutchinson back but secondary issues deepen before Eagles clash



Lions‚Äô Aidan Hutchinson Details Recovery From Season-Ending Injury + Regrets Not Meeting Eminem üò±

More coverage in NFL:

The Detroit Lions enter Week 11 with a mix of optimism and growing anxiety as they prepare for a nationally televised clash with the Philadelphia Eagles. While the return of star pass rusher Aidan Hutchinson boosts Detroit‚Äôs confidence, a wave of secondary injuries is threatening to unravel the team‚Äôs defensive stability at the worst possible time.This matchup carries major playoff implications, and the Lions know that limiting Jalen Hurts and Philadelphia‚Äôs explosive receiving duo is critical. Hutchinson‚Äôs availability helps, but the mounting issues in the defensive backfield are the main concern this week and could play a major role in how Sunday night unfolds.Aidan Hutchinson‚Äôs full return to practice on Thursday delivered the good news Detroit desperately needed. After sitting out Wednesday with an elbow issue, the star edge rusher was cleared to resume full work, signaling his readiness for Week 11. Hutchinson has been one of the driving forces behind Detroit‚Äôs top-tier pressure numbers, and his presence is essential to containing Hurts‚Äô mobility and disrupting Philadelphia‚Äôs rhythm.However, the Lions‚Äô secondary is moving in the opposite direction. Cornerback Amik Robertson was added to the injury report with a hamstring problem, creating another major concern.Robertson has frequently served as Detroit‚Äôs No. 1 corner due to injuries elsewhere, making his status crucial for a defense preparing to face AJ Brown and DeVonta Smith.Veteran corner DJ Reed, sidelined since Week 4 with a hamstring strain, practiced in a limited capacity for the second straight day, but the team has yet to decide whether to activate him for Sunday. Rookie Terrion Arnold remains in concussion protocol and hasn‚Äôt practiced all week, while safety Kerby Joseph is expected to miss his fourth straight game with a knee issue. If Robertson is unavailable and Reed isn‚Äôt cleared, Detroit may be forced to rely on Rock Ya-Sin and Nick Whiteside against one of the NFL‚Äôs toughest passing attacks.Offensively, tight end Sam LaPorta missed his second consecutive practice with a back injury, creating uncertainty around one of Jared Goff‚Äôs most reliable weapons. The Lions also saw defensive tackle Pat O‚ÄôConnor downgraded to a non-participant, while Taylor Decker, Penei Sewell, Marcus Davenport, Josh Paschal, Sione Vaki, and Brock Wright were limited. Malcolm Rodriguez and Graham Glasgow practiced fully, offering at least some stability heading into Sunday. With so many moving pieces, the Lions‚Äô depth and resilience will be tested as they aim to hold their ground in a crucial Week 11 showdown.
Article Summary: Detroit lions face philadelphia eagles in nationally televised game on sunday. Aidan hutchinson returned to practice after elbow injury. But secondary injuries threaten to unravel team's defensive stability. Cornerback amik robertson was added to the injury report with a hamstring problem.

Article Title: John Beam dies after Laney College shooting as Last Chance U coach leaves Oakland in mourning
Article Text:
John Beam dies after Laney College shooting as Last Chance U coach leaves Oakland in mourning (Image via Getty)

C.J. Anderson and former players mourn John Beam



John Beam, the well-known Laney College coach and ‚ÄúLast Chance U‚Äù star, has died after being shot on the college campus in Oakland. He was 66 years old. Police said the shooting was targeted, and they have arrested a suspect. The shooting happened on Thursday at the Laney fieldhouse. John Beam was rushed to the hospital, but he did not survive.This sad news has shocked the whole Oakland community. Students, players, and local leaders said John Beam helped many young people for more than 40 years. The Associated Press said he was shot in the head. A vigil was held outside the hospital as people waited and prayed for him.John Beam worked at Laney College for many years and became known worldwide after appearing in Season 5 of the Netflix show ‚ÄúLast Chance U.‚Äù Before Laney, he coached at Skyline High School in Oakland. He was respected by players, parents, and coaches.Former NFL running back C.J. Anderson, who played for John Beam at Laney, shared many posts on X. On Thursday, he wrote, ‚ÄúKeep fighting. Keep praying.‚Äù After John Beam died, he posted a broken-heart emoji. Other former players also shared how John Beam helped them when they had no support. They said he cared about every player and always pushed them to stay strong.Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee said the last two days were very hard for the city because this was the second school shooting in two days. She said schools should be safe places and asked for guns to be removed from streets.Police said they arrested the suspect soon after the shooting. They said the attack was not random. The suspect had some past link to a school where John Beam once coached. A gun was recovered.Also Read: Who Is Cedric Irving Jr? Oakland Police Name The Suspect As Laney College Mourns John Beam‚Äôs Death John Beam coached at Skyline High School before joining Laney in 2004. He became head coach in 2012 and later became the athletic director. Even after he stopped coaching, he stayed close to the team. He helped many players reach big colleges and the NFL. People in Oakland say they have lost a mentor, a friend, and a hero who changed many young lives.
Article Summary: John beam, 66, was shot in the head at laney college in oakland, california. Police said the shooting was targeted and they have arrested a suspect. John beam coached at skyline high school before joining laney in 2004. He helped many players reach big colleges and the nfl.

Article Title: Percy Harvin‚Äôs Gainesville home fire raises new fears in Florida after similar shocking cases involving top sports names
Article Text:
Percy Harvin‚Äôs Gainesville home fire raises new fears in Florida after similar shocking cases involving top sports names (Image Via Getty)

Percy Harvin‚Äôs Florida home fire brings fast response and raises safety concerns



Percy Harvin, the former NFL wide receiver and Florida Gators star, had a scary moment on Thursday evening when his home in Gainesville, Florida, suddenly caught fire. The flames grew fast, and people living on the same street could see the bright glow from their windows. One neighbor even took a quick video as the fire moved across the roof. Fire trucks reached the home within minutes, and the lights from the trucks filled the whole block. Early updates say everyone is okay, and no serious injuries have been reported.The house is only a short drive from the University of Florida campus, where Percy Harvin became a huge name while playing from 2006 to 2008. Because the fire spread quickly, firefighters and deputies asked people nearby to step out of their homes until things were safe again. Crews worked from different sides of the house to calm the flames. Officials still do not know what started the fire, and the investigation is still active.The Alachua County Sheriff‚Äôs Office said on Friday morning that deputies and fire rescue teams responded right away after getting the call about the fire on Thursday night.While deputies worked on evacuating nearby residences and obstructing the road, a representative stated Alachua County Fire Rescue managed the flames.Firemen used hoses from various angles to ensure the fire stopped spreading. It is unknown right now whether any family members including Percy Harvin were inside the house when the fire erupted.Because of his college career before becoming the 22nd pick in the 2009 NFL Draft, Percy Harvin, 37, is still really well liked in the Gainesville neighborhood.When they heard the news, several city supporters were anxious but were comforted after discovering no one was severely hurt.Also Read: Is Eminem Performing On NFL Thanksgiving? Detroit Lions Drop A Big Announcement Ahead Of Game This is not the only fire involving a well-known sports figure in Florida recently. Just last week, Miami Heat head coach Erik Spoelstra‚Äôs home caught fire in South Florida.Tyreek Hill, an NFL star, also went through a similar episode earlier last year when his house caught fire. Many people have started to question if homes in specific areas of the state run a greater fire risk as a result of these back-to-back incidents.Fire department personnel say they are still investigating the source of the fire at Percy Harvin's home for the time being.
Article Summary: Percy harvin, the former nfl wide receiver and florida gators star, had a scary moment on thursday evening when his home in gainesville, florida, suddenly caught fire. The flames grew fast, and people living on the same street could see the bright glow from their windows.

Article Title: Inside H-1B row: How Trump‚Äôs sudden U-turns could leave America losing the talent war to foreigners
Article Text:
'No Talent In U.S.': Trump BURNS MAGA Base For India Reset? What It Means For Indian Workers

What are H1-B visas and who uses them



How are American jobs at risk



Supporters say the programme keeps America competitive



MAGA does not like Trump's U-turn







A heated national row over jobs, immigration and the future of the American workforce has intensified after President Donald Trump suggested that the United States ‚Äúdoesn‚Äôt have certain talents‚Äù earlier this week, even as the Trump Administation tightens rules around the H1-B visa programme.The GOP leader's latest comments have reignited a long-running political fight over whether foreign workers are helping American innovation or displacing American workers.The H1-B visa allows companies to hire highly skilled foreign workers in specialised fields for up to six years. It is intended for people of ‚Äúexceptional merit and ability‚Äù, typically with at least a bachelor‚Äôs degree. The tech sector remains the biggest user of the programme, accounting for up to 70 percent of applications each year. Engineering, consulting, healthcare and university research also rely heavily on the visa.India dominates the applicant pool, making up 73 per cent of all H1-B visa holders, followed by China at 12 per cent, according to Fox News. Universities and non-profit research institutions are exempt from the usual annual cap of 65,000 visas, plus an additional 20,000 for applicants with advanced degrees, which means the total number of approvals is often far higher.Pew Research Center estimates around 400,000 approvals in the last year alone.Opposition to the programme spans both Republicans and Democrats. Critics argue that the system is being abused to import cheaper labour and push aside American workers.In September, Trump issued a presidential proclamation accusing the H1-B system of being ‚Äúdeliberately exploited to replace, rather than supplement, American workers with lower-paid, lower-skilled labour‚Äù. He said this practice ‚Äúhas undermined both our economic and national security‚Äù.Trump imposed a $100,000 fee on each new H1-B visa application, effective September 21. His administration is also introducing stricter definitions of ‚Äúspecialty occupation‚Äù, expanding compliance inspections, and requiring employers to file applications directly rather than through third-party contractors.Many business leaders warn that harsh restrictions could push talent and investment overseas. The US Chamber of Commerce has filed a lawsuit to block the new $100,000 fee, arguing it violates immigration law and would make the programme ‚Äúcost-prohibitive‚Äù for small and mid-size companies.Elon Musk is among the most vocal defenders of the visa system, noting that many of the engineers who helped build Tesla and SpaceX first arrived in the United States on H1-B visas. He said, ‚ÄúThe reason I‚Äôm in America along with so many critical people who built SpaceX, Tesla, and hundreds of other companies that made America strong is because of H1B.‚ÄùDespite his own sweeping restrictions, Trump stirred a row this week by insisting that the United States still needed foreign workers because ‚Äúpeople have to learn‚Äù. He added that ‚Äúthe United States doesn‚Äôt have certain talents‚Äù and warned that some highly technical defence and technology roles cannot simply be filled by ‚Äútaking people off an unemployment line‚Äù.His remarks have frustrated parts of his MAGA base, who view the comment as undercutting his America First message. Others argue it reveals the core tension at the centre of the H1-B debate: the nation wants to protect American jobs, but it also fears falling behind global competitors like China, which recently launched its own talent visa known as the K visa.
Article Summary: 'no talent in u.s.': trump burns maga base for india reset? What it means for indian workers. The gop leader's latest comments have reignited a long-running political fight over whether foreign workers are helping american innovation or displacing american workers.

Article Title: White House press secretary calls climate change 'fallacy', social media says 'she mispronounced science'
Article Text:
Social media response

"Climate change is a lie"‚Äî a person who never opened a science book.

Over 99% of climate scientists globally endorse the reality and human causation of climate change, based on the most comprehensive recent literature reviews. This near-unanimity underscores the urgency for action, as affirmed by bodies like the IPCC and national academies.

globally endorse the reality and human causation of climate change, based on the most comprehensive recent literature reviews. This near-unanimity underscores the urgency for action, as affirmed by bodies like the IPCC and national academies. Why does the right hate environmental issues so much lol? I mean even if you think climate change is a hoax, don‚Äôt you still care about taking care of the environment?

People are still trying to deny that climate change is real?!

Poorly educated people are put in trump's cabinet in an attempt to make trump seem smart.

When you go to college on a softball scholarship and it shows.





Karoline Leavitt stirred a fresh row after claiming that climate change is ‚Äúbased on a fallacy." Environmental activists were not very happy with White House Press Secretary's comments.Leavitt made the remark during an appearance on Fox News while attacking California‚Äôs Democratic governor, Gavin Newsom. Leavitt accused him of damaging the state with environmental policies she mocked as the ‚ÄúGreen New Scam‚Äù. She said, ‚ÄúGavin has done so much damage to his state, with the ‚ÄòGreen New Scam‚Äô and with this utopian pursuit of climate change that is just so false, it's built on a fallacy, and he's built up energy costs [so much] that people are fleeing the state. ‚Äù Her comments run counter to the overwhelming scientific consensus on global warming.Recently, Congress released tens of thousands of Jeffrey Epstein‚Äôs emails, which implicated that US President Trump knew about Epstein and the 'underage girls' in the sex trafficker's house. Democratic lawmakers have also advanced a petition to the White House demanding that even more related records be made public.
Article Summary: Leavitt made the remark during an appearance on fox news while attacking california‚Äôs democratic governor, gavin newsom. Leavitt accused him of damaging the state with environmental policies she mocked as the ‚Äògreen new scam‚Äô her comments run counter to the overwhelming scientific consensus on global warming.

Article Title: JD Vance on foreign workers amid H-1B row: 'We don't need low-wage servants'
Article Text:
Vice President JD Vance says America does not need low-wage foreign labors.

'No Talent In U.S.': Trump BURNS MAGA Base For India Reset? What It Means For Indian Workers





Vice President JD Vance spoke out on the issue of foreign workers in the US amid the ongoing H-1B row triggered by President Donald Trump's recent statement that US needs 'certain' talents from other countries. As Vance spoke to Sean Hannity, he said the Democrat model was to import more low-wage immigrants which he said hurt the jobs, wages and prosperity.Vance said the choice is between low-wage immigrants and American citizens empowered by technology. The VP said Trump's model is the second one which will pave prosperity for America.As Vance said US should avoid relying on low-wage workers and instead focus on using technology to empower the blue-collar workers, he struck a different chord with the President. Because the president said America lacks certain types of talent and cited the example of the battery plant in Georgia that was raided.‚ÄúThey raided because they wanted illegal immigrants out. They had people from South Korea that made batteries all their lives. You know, making batteries are very complicated. It‚Äôs not an easy thing and very dangerous," Trump said adding that the South Korean company had ‚Äúlike five or six hundred people, to make batteries and to teach people how to do it.Well, they wanted them to get out of the country. "You're going to need that," Trump said when he was asked whether H-1B visa will be a big priority for his administration.H-1B visa program is for high-skilled individuals, mostly employed in tech and education sectors. But while Trump said US needs foreign workers, Vance said US does not need low-wage foreign workers.‚ÄúTheir (the Democrats) idea was the way that we get more prosperity is that you import more and more low-wage servants and that actually I think reduced prosperity, because it meant that a lot of our blue-collar workers were struggling. But if you use technology and you empower the blue-collar workers rather than replace them with foreign labor, I think they are going to do way better, they are going to make higher wages and the whole country is going to be better off," Vance said."In other words, do you depend on low-wage immigrants or do you depend on American citizens bolstered by technology and innovation? That‚Äôs the Trump model," Vance added.
Article Summary: Vice president jd vance says america does not need low-wage foreign labors. H-1b visa program is for high-skilled individuals, mostly employed in tech and education sectors. Trump said us needs 'certain' talents from other countries.

Article Title: Epstein emails: List of celebrities named in latest files
Article Text:
Epstein was in touch with several celebrities, journalists, Trump's friends and enemies, new files reveal.

David Blaine

EXPOSED: Epstein Secretly Tracked Trump Years After Their ‚ÄòBreakup‚Äô | Big Reveal In Leaked Emails

Former Israeli Prime Minister Ehud Barak

Linguist Noam Chomsky

Venture capitalist Peter Thiel

Author Deepak Chopra

Author Michael Wolff

Former treasury secretary Larry Summers

Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, former prince

Reporter Landon Thomas Jr

Former White House counsel Kathryn Ruemmler

Steve Bannon

Publicist Peggy Siegal





The Donald Trump administration has been shaken by the new revelations that came to the fore regarding sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The Democrats released email correspondence of Epstein to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform. The emails reveal that Epstein was in touch with many celebrities, both friends and enemies of Donald Trump and he spoke with them on a wide range of issues.The emails do not implicate the named celebrities of any wrongdoing. Some of the prominent names who exchanged mails with Epstein are:David Blaine is an illusionist whose name cropped up as he exchanged emails with Epstein. In one undated letter to the US Citizenship and Immigration Services, Blaine wrote in support of a visa for "an amazing fashion model" he had met. In a brief October 2016 email, Epstein wrote, ‚Äúdinner with woody sun?‚Äù to which Blaine responded, ‚ÄúGreat.‚ÄùBarak allegedly discussed Middle Eastern politics with Epstein. They coordinated meetings, including notes about his availability in August 2015 and discussions of intellectual material circulating among Epstein‚Äôs social circle.Between 2015 and 2017, Epstein and Noam Chomsky apparently exchanged emails discussing about politics, world affairs and linguistics.They also discussed President Donald Trump and his incoming administration in 2016.Messages between Epstein and Peter Thiel ‚Äîco-founder of PayPal and billionaire Republican donor ‚Äîsuggested intermittent contact, with Epstein writing in one email in May 2014, ‚ÄúThat was fun, see you in 3 weeks.‚ÄùIn November 2016, Epstein and Indian-American author Deepak Chopra exchanged emails. Epstein shared a link to a news article on how Katie Johnson, who accused Donald Trump of raping her when she was aged 13 at an alleged Epstein ‚Äúsex party,‚Äù abruptly dropped her civil lawsuit. Chopra asked Epstein whether Katie dropped the civil case against Epstein also.Journalist and author Michael Wolff and Epstein exchanged emails on various issues, including news reports on Epstein. He told Wolff in an email that Clinton was never there on the island, infamously known as Epstein Island.Summers served as Treasury Secretary in the Bill Clinton Administration from 1999 to 2001 and as Director of the White House National Economic Council in the Barack Obama Administration from 2009 to 2010.Summers criticized Trump in his mail exchanges with Epstein. In October 2017, he wrote that Trump was the ‚Äúworld s luckiest guy in terms of opposition, economy etc.‚ÄùEpstein and Andrew exchanged emails on Virginia Giuffre, who accused Andrew of raping him when she was a minor and she used to work for Epstein. Epstein forwarded ‚Äúthe Duke‚Äù an email in March 2011 about an upcoming Daily Mail story about Giuffre‚Äôs allegations against Andrew. ‚ÄúThe Duke‚Äù wrote back: ‚ÄúWhat? I don‚Äôt know any of this. How are you responding?‚Äù ‚ÄúJust got it two minutes ago. I‚Äôve asked g lawyers to send a letter,‚Äù Epstein said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not sure how to respond, the only person she didn‚Äôt have sex with was Elvis.‚ÄùThe then New York Times reporter emailed Epstein about the Giuffre case to which Epstein wrote back that her allegations against Andrew were delusional.Former White House counsel Kathryn Ruemmler, who served in the Obama Administration, exchanged emails with Epstein, many of which revolved around personal conversations.Former Trump adviser Steve Bannon and Epstein exchanged emails on Trump, Andrew, and Virginia Giuffre.Epstein wrote to Siegal in 2011 over Giuffre's story. He asked her to reach out to a media house and inform them that Giuffre was a fraud.
Article Summary: Jeffrey epstein was in touch with several celebrities, journalists, trump's friends and enemies, new files reveal. David blaine is an illusionist whose name cropped up as he exchanged emails with epstein. Epstein and noam chomsky apparently exchanged emails discussing about politics, world affairs and linguistics.

Article Text: Elon Musk revealed he arrived in Montreal at 17 with only $2500, a bag of clothes, and books. Article Title: Candace Owens lists 10 TPUSA verifiable lies and raises big questions about Charlie Kirk‚Äôs assassination story
Article Text:
Candace Owens lists 10 TPUSA verifiable lies and raises big questions about Charlie Kirk‚Äôs assassination story (Image via Getty)

Candace Owens Believes Tyler Robinson 'Didn't Kill Charlie Kirk': 'I Have Leaks...'

Time Stamp: 15:01

Megyn Kelly Goes SCORCHED EARTH On Those Lying About Charlie Kirk. | Candace Ep 263

Candace Owens explains her list of ‚Äúverifiable lies‚Äù told after Charlie Kirk‚Äôs assassination





Image via Candace/Podcast

She said the first lie was the story that Mikey McCoy had ‚Äúblood all over him.‚Äù She said this story was made up and was told by Pastor Rob McCoy.

The second lie, she said, came from Alex Clark and Andrew Kolvet. She said they pushed a story that Charlie Kirk was a ‚Äúcommitted evangelical‚Äù who only liked Catholic buildings. Owens said this was not true.

The third lie was a strange story that Charlie Kirk‚Äôs ‚Äústrong bones‚Äù stopped a 30-06 bullet. She said Andrew Kolvet pushed this and that it made no sense.

The fourth lie, she said, was the claim that Charlie ‚Äúnever blinked‚Äù in his support for Israel. Owens said this was not true.

For the fifth lie, she said TPUSA told people that Mikey McCoy first called his dad during the crisis. Owens said this story was also false.

The sixth lie was about Terryl Farnsworth, the AV worker. She said TPUSA claimed police told him to remove cameras. Owens said her video review shows this did not happen.

The seventh lie was the claim that Farnsworth moved SD cards because ‚Äúpeople were stealing them.‚Äù She said this made no sense because SD cards are cheap and cameras are expensive.

The eighth lie came from Alex Clark, who said there was ‚Äúno bad blood‚Äù between Ben Shapiro and Charlie Kirk. Owens said that was ‚Äúpropaganda.‚Äù

The ninth lie was that TPUSA‚Äôs yearly audits proved nothing odd. Candace Owens said this was misleading because Doge worked differently from normal TPUSA work.

The tenth lie was calling Mikey McCoy a ‚Äúhero.‚Äù Candace Owens said this was not fair because he did not call 911 right away.





Candace Owens spoke on her podcast on November 13, 2025. She said she found ten ‚Äúverifiable lies‚Äù that she believes Turning Point USA (TPUSA) told after Charlie Kirk was killed. Charlie Kirk was shot in the neck on September 10, 2025, at Utah Valley University in Orem, Utah. The next day, 22-year-old Tyler James Robinson was arrested for the shooting. Owens said she will keep talking about this case because she feels she is getting ‚Äúvery close‚Äù to the real truth, and she believes some people at TPUSA are upset with her for this.In her show, Candace Owens said TPUSA gave wrong or confusing stories about what happened that day. She said some stories made people sound more heroic, more loyal, or more important than they really were. She also said some stories changed facts about Charlie Kirk, his beliefs, his staff, and what happened at the scene.Candace Owens then shared the ten lies she says TPUSA spread. She said her list is not final, but these were the lies she wanted to clear up right now.Candace Owens said she will keep talking about the Charlie Kirk case on her Candace podcast.Also Read: Candace Owens And Allie Beth Stuckey Spark Big Drama As New Words On Charlie Kirk Assassination Go Viral
Article Summary: Candace owens lists 10 tpusa verifiable lies and raises big questions about charlie kirk‚Äôs assassination story. Candace owens spoke on her podcast on november 13, 2025. She said she found ten ‚Äúverifiable lies‚Äù that she believes turning point usa told after charlie kirk was killed.

Article Title: Olivia Nuzzi drops bombshell on 'affair with RFK Jr': He said 'I love you' first; wanted her to have his baby
Article Text:
Olivia Nuzzi is back with her explosive book where she claimed RFK Jr wanted her to have his baby -- without naming RFK Jr.





After a year of self-exile, journalist Olivia Nuzzi is back with her bombshell book 'American Canto' due to be released next month, with threadbare details of her affair with 71-year-old RFK Jr, without naming him. Nuzzi was fired from her job at New York Magazine after her secret romance with RFK Jr came to the public and her engagement with journalist Ryan Lizza was also canceled.32-year-old Nuzzi disappeared from the public eye and reportedly spent time in Malibu writing her book. The book reveals that she was in love with Kennedy but only after Kennedy told her 'I love you' first. Kennedy used to calle her 'Livvy' and wrote poems to her; he told her he'd take a bullet for her and also expressed his desire for her to have his child.‚ÄúShe writes that the first few times Kennedy said he loved her, she did not say it back,‚Äù the New York Times reported in its article 'Olivia Nuzzi did it all for love'. ‚ÄúYet she knew she felt the same. ‚ÄòI love him, I thought. Oh no. I love him so much.‚Äô They spoke often and were intimate enough for her to see him flossing his teeth, his dopp kit overflowing with prescriptions.‚ÄùNuzzi wrote that the mutual infatuation consumed her but it was never consummated, keeping the nature of their relationship ambiguous.Nuzzi revealed that though Trump's health secretary publicly claims to be "sober" for decades, he told her that he was taking psychedelics and smoked the powerful drug dimethyltryptamine, or DMT."She didn‚Äôt care that he was 39 years older than her. She liked him just the way he was. They both 'moved through the world with amused detachment and deep sensitivity, contradictions that worked somehow in concert'," the NYT noted.When the affair became public, Kennedy Jr dismissed it and said he had just met her once for a piece she was writing. Nuzzi wrote in her book that as news broke of their relationship in September 2024, he told her, ‚ÄúIf it‚Äôs just sex, I can survive it.‚Äù She told him she would do whatever he needed her to do.
Article Summary: Olivia nuzzi was fired from her job at new york magazine after her secret romance with rfk jr came to the public. She disappeared from the public eye and reportedly spent time in malibu writing her book. The book reveals that she was in love with kennedy but only after kennedy told her 'i love you' first.

Article Title: Northern lights may dazzle skies across more than 20 US states tonight: When, how and tips to watch Aurora Borealis tonight
Article Text:
Source: Live Science

US states could witness the Aurora Borealis tonight : Check the list





Alaska

North Dakota

Minnesota

Montana

Wisconsin

Michigan

Maine

South Dakota

Idaho

Vermont

Washington

New Hampshire

Wyoming

New York

Iowa

Massachusetts

Pennsylvania

Nebraska

Ohio

Illinois

Indiana

When and how to watch the Northern Lights





What makes this Aurora event unique





Understanding the science behind the Northern Lights





How geomagnetic storms are classified





Tips to improve your chances of seeing the Northern Lights





Find a dark viewing spot far from city lights and face north for the best view. Light pollution can wash out faint auroras, so rural or elevated areas are ideal.

Use your smartphone camera as many modern phone cameras are more sensitive to light than the human eye and can detect faint auroras before they become visible.

Let your eyes adjust to the dark for at least 20 to 30 minutes and avoid looking at bright screens. This allows your vision to adapt to low light and makes it easier to spot subtle colour shifts in the sky.

Dress warmly because temperatures can drop significantly at night, especially in northern regions. Layered clothing, gloves, and hats are essential for comfort during long viewing periods.

Be patient. The Northern Lights are unpredictable and can appear suddenly. Staying outdoors for an extended period improves your chances of witnessing the spectacle.

What to do if you miss tonight‚Äôs display





Also Read |





The night sky across the United States is expected to dazzle millions as the Northern Lights, or aurora borealis, become visible in over twenty states from November 11 to 12, 2025. This rare spectacle is fueled by heightened solar activity, including several powerful solar eruptions that send charged particles hurtling toward Earth at incredible speeds. As these particles interact with the planet‚Äôs magnetic field, they create stunning displays of shifting light in shades of green, pink, and violet, dancing across the sky in dynamic, ever-changing patterns. The phenomenon, usually confined to polar regions, may reach as far south as states like Kansas and Virginia, offering a rare opportunity for Americans to witness one of nature‚Äôs most captivating and colourful celestial events.The Northern Lights, or aurora borealis, are expected to dazzle skywatchers across the United States tonight, offering a rare opportunity for millions to witness one of nature‚Äôs most mesmerising displays. According to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), enhanced solar activity has created ideal conditions for auroral visibility, pushing the colourful phenomenon much farther south than usual.If weather conditions remain clear, shimmering curtains of green, pink, and violet light could illuminate the skies across multiple regions, from the Pacific Northwest to the Northeast. This widespread coverage marks one of the most extensive Northern Lights forecasts in recent years, making tonight a particularly exciting occasion for stargazers and photographers alike.Here‚Äôs the list of US states:Timing is crucial for observing the aurora borealis. NOAA‚Äôs three-day geomagnetic forecast predicts that activity will peak late in the evening and continue into the early hours of 12 November. The best viewing windows are expected to be between 4 pm and 10 pm EST (2100‚Äì0300 GMT) for minor to moderate activity, and between 10 pm and 1 am EST (0300‚Äì0600 GMT) for stronger geomagnetic storm levels.During these peak hours, observers may witness luminous arcs or shimmering curtains of light dancing across the northern horizon. In some areas, the lights could stretch overhead in glowing ribbons that shift and ripple as magnetic fields interact.The combination of multiple CMEs and an exceptionally powerful solar flare makes this event stand out from recent auroral displays. The convergence of these solar bursts increases the likelihood of intense geomagnetic disturbances. Such interactions can create stacked auroras, where layers of colour overlap, giving the sky an even richer appearance. The last time auroras of this strength reached similar latitudes was during strong solar events several years ago. Additionally, solar activity tends to rise and fall in roughly 11-year cycles known as solar cycles. We are currently nearing the peak of Solar Cycle 25, which explains the recent increase in both sunspots and flares that are the main drivers of auroral events, producing spectacular skies visible to many observers across high-latitude regions.The Northern Lights occur when streams of charged particles from the Sun, known as the solar wind, reach Earth and interact with gases in the upper atmosphere. These collisions release energy in the form of light, producing the stunning patterns that dance across the sky.Oxygen atoms are responsible for the green and red colours most commonly seen, while nitrogen produces blue and purple hues. The exact colours depend on which gases are hit and at what altitude the interactions take place.This week‚Äôs event is particularly special because several coronal mass ejections (CMEs), enormous bursts of plasma and magnetic energy from the Sun, are headed toward Earth. These CMEs are part of heightened solar activity linked to an X5.1-class solar flare, the most powerful flare recorded so far in 2025. When these charged particles collide with Earth‚Äôs magnetic field, they can cause strong geomagnetic storms, expanding the auroral oval and pushing the Northern Lights much farther south than usual.Geomagnetic storms are measured on a five-level scale from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme). These classifications are determined by the strength of the disturbance in Earth‚Äôs magnetic field.A G3 storm is strong enough to make auroras visible at mid-latitudes, while a G4 storm can extend the visibility range even farther south and may affect some radio communications and satellite operations. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) has issued a G4 geomagnetic storm watch, suggesting that much of the continental United States could witness the aurora. It is rare for auroras to reach such southern latitudes, making this a potentially historic event for skywatchers.While space weather determines when the aurora will occur, your viewing experience depends largely on preparation and local conditions. Experts recommend several strategies to increase your odds of seeing the lights clearly.If cloudy skies or poor visibility spoil your view tonight, there is still hope. The sequence of solar eruptions means geomagnetic activity could remain elevated for several days. Keep an eye on forecast updates through NOAA‚Äôs channels or dedicated aurora-tracking apps, as new opportunities may arise later this week.Even if you miss this particular show, solar activity is expected to stay strong for the remainder of the year, providing additional chances for aurora sightings across mid-latitudes.
Article Summary: The northern lights, or aurora borealis, are expected to dazzle skywatchers across the united states tonight. This rare spectacle is fueled by heightened solar activity, including several powerful solar eruptions. As these particles interact with the planet‚Äôs magnetic field, they create stunning displays of shifting light in shades of green, pink, and violet.

Article Title: Billionaire Barry Sternlicht says Mamdani will turn New York City into Mumbai, his team considering leaving
Article Text:
Billionaire real estate investor Barry Sternlicht said New York will turn into Mumbai under Zohran Mamdani's administration.

‚ÄòDeport Him‚Ä¶‚Äô: Team Trump Moves To Strip Mamdani Of US Citizenship After NYC Win

New York will survive, but will get worse before it gets better







Billionaire real estate investor Barry Sternlicht, the chairman and CEO of Starwood Capital Group, said New York City under new mayor Zohran Mamdani will turn into Mumbai as he pledged to freeze rents because tenants' incomes have stagnated. Sternlicht who has both commercial and residential holdings in NYC said when one neighbor finds out that their neighbor is not paying, they stop paying and thus NYC will turn into Mumbai.‚ÄúOver $100 million, every project in New York has to go union, and it‚Äôs super expensive. It leads to extremely expensive housing. And other developers have tried to cut deals with the unions, but they rule New York, and that‚Äôs one of the key reasons the blue states are so expensive and they‚Äôre so difficult to add supply of housing to,‚Äù Sternlicht said in an interview with CNBC Property Play, reacting to Mamdani's win.‚ÄúAnd then the far left gets really nuts and says the tenants don‚Äôt have to pay. Well, you can‚Äôt kick them out if they don‚Äôt pay. So the neighbor finds out the neighbor isn‚Äôt paying, and they don‚Äôt pay, and the next guy doesn‚Äôt pay, and then you‚Äôre basically going to turn New York City into Mumbai," he said.Sternlicht said his New York team is considering leaving the city as well.‚ÄúThe core issues are not what he‚Äôs focusing on. We need to increase housing.That‚Äôs not going to happen easily, right? You need serious subsidies from the government if they want us to work with unions. The unions have to be more accommodative on their work laws and the wages and everything else, otherwise you can‚Äôt add economically," he said. Sternlicht said rent freezing is not the solution but increasing housing is.Sternlicht said he believed New York will survive but will first gets a lot worse before it gets better. ‚ÄúPeople are working really hard. Just how do we help others to do well and believe in the American dream? That‚Äôs probably a better message for a leader in the city than saying, let‚Äôs just tax everyone who‚Äôs been successful, force them to leave and then have to rely on Washington for handouts to basically keep the city going,‚Äù Sternlicht added.
Article Summary: Billionaire real estate investor barry sternlicht said new york will turn into mumbai under new mayor zohran mamdani's administration. He said rent freezing is not the solution but increasing housing is. ‚Äúpeople are working really hard. Just how do we help others to do well and believe in the american dream?
